TopicTitle: My thoughts on KSP money, the sequel.

Articles.Content:
To continue this thread...

If the finances of the game were derived from both public and private organizations it'd make the most sense. You'd gain science and some money by completing missions as happens currently with science only. After a successful amount of research on the mun or some other location you will discover a resource (or perhaps get a lead from a firm and general coordinates of a site they've surveyed from afar but need you to do a local survey of), thus attracting private firms for exploitation. The door is then open for mega bucks to get into the game once the machine of kerbins industrial society kicks in as they would require you to install some sort of means of extracting and delivering the resource back to them.

If however you want the game to be a science Sim where all funding is from gov then the purpose of money would basically be just to raise and lower your budget based on overall success. Too many mission failures could possibly tank the game for you.

I like allowing fictional private interests in the game where exploitation of resources is happening as it would feel like a future space Sim where we are truly conquering the solar system. Now it feels like a fantasy historical space Sim, very cool to be sure, but govt only funding is not where space exploration in the real world is headed.
